posts.cooked: hi, a have a little project for my team that need to control  robot  in a far distance. the way i thinked to do this  is to  put a laptop that connects with the robot and use some external program to conect to this laptop remotely. but for this to work, the robot laptop will need to conect to the robot and with the internet at the same time. is there a way to do this ? or you guys have another solution for the problem ?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: I like making sparks with batteries

posts.custom_user_title: I like making sparks with batteries

posts.name: Bjorn Janssen
posts.cooked: We use an wifi adapter that basically “adds” an additional connection option to your laptop. Anything that kinda looks like this one will work.
Hi!  Please be careful.  If the driver’s station is unattended it could be dangerous.

Specifically if there are controls attached to it. Random people will come and start touching things. Some may even touch things (in a way that would have flattened a group of children if the robot was enabled) and then demand to know why it is not working.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: neev dadhania
posts.cooked: while this might not be exactly what you need, over the summer we had a robot set up so that its wheels were not touching the ground, the sparkmaxes were all limited to 1a, and a laptop was on the school wifi and connected to the robot via usb. we used chrome remote desktop to connect to the robot and an HP 700w server power supply to get 12v to the robot. worked through the summer to allow code to be worked on and tested, except for drivetrain.

posts.name: Jared Hasen-Klein
posts.cooked:
Bjorn:

We use an wifi adapter that basically “adds” an additional connection option to your laptop. Anything that kinda looks like this one will work.

If you do this, I’d strongly recommend using the built in network connection for robot communication and this additional adapter for WAN.
